intro: Microthlaspi umbellatum, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in an umbel. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and arctic regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments. Microthlaspi umbellatum is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments.
